title: Customer Service Representative - Technical Support
description:
The Technical Customer Contact Centre, located in Cape Town, currently has 8 vacancies for Customer Service Representatives - Technical Support, who, reporting to the Team Manager, will be responsible to telephonically (not limited to) respond to the needs of MWEB customers within the prescribed scope of support. Customer Service Representatives are required to understand the requirements of the customer and to deliver fast, professional support, accurate, relevant product information and to resolve or correctly escalate the customer. Customer Service Representatives are responsible for customer interactions that result in resolved queries within scope whilst ensuring that quality and cost effectiveness is maintained.

Duties & Responsibilities•	Schedule adherence•	Service technical inbound/outbound call traffic•	Identify customers needs•	Provide solutions •	Resolve customer queries, complaints and objections•	Record customer information

Required Skills•	Result orientation•	Listening•	Learning orientation•	Team orientation/relationship building•	Objection handling•	High tolerance level/resilience •	Customer service orientation•	Able to respond dynamically to change•	Attention to detail•	Computer literacy•	Troubleshooting skills•	Bilingual •	Strong communication skills – written and verbal •	Flexibility

Qualifications and experience required•	Proven product knowledge and experience in an ADSL/Wireless environment•	2 years inbound call centre experience•	Good understanding of call centre practices•	Thorough Understanding of internet and email•	Basic knowledge of computer hardware and software•	Knowledge of operating systems, e.g. Windows 95, 98, Me, 2000, XP, Vista, Windows 7 & 10 and MAC•	IT qualification will be an advantage (A+ Course/MCDST preferable)














More




														We are committed to Employment Equity when recruiting internally and externally. It is company policy to promote from within wherever possible. Therefore, please be aware that internal candidates will be given first preference.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Media24, based in Cape Town, is committed to being a data-driven organisation. Spree is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to support business objectives through conclusive data analysis and modelling. You will discover insights and identify opportunities by immersing yourself in the business, sourcing the required data sets, and coherently working towards solving the challenge at hand. Your outputs would be in the form of reports and visualisations that clearly articulate the findings to business recipients.You will be part of a dynamic and flexible team, finding solutions to a variety of challenges across many different businesses within Media24 working in ecommerce, digital media, logistics, and print publishing.



Minimum Requirements•	Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Engineering, or Statistics•	Minimum of 5 years’ experience working as a data analyst



Skills & Competencies•	Advanced SQL skills and the ability to effectively extract data from databases•	Advanced Excel skills•	Experience working with Qlikview or other data exploration/analytical platforms•	Understanding of dimensional database fundamentals/principles•	Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information in the form of reports and visualisations with attention to detail and accuracy•	The ability to visualise outputs in an engaging way•	Business acumen and the ability to translate analyses to business objectives•	The ability to clean data when required to create a workable data set•	Creative, conceptual, problem-solving, critical, and innovative thinking•	Flexibility and autonomy•	Good written and verbal communication skills



Duties & Responsibilities•	Interpret system, courier, stock and cost performance data, analyse the results using appropriate techniques/tools •	Acquire data from primary and secondary data sources •	Maintain databases/systems •	Identify, analyse and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets •	Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to make corrections •	Work with key stakeholders to prioritise business and information needs •	Identify opportunities for process improvements flowing from analyses and assist in projects that emanate from them •	Generate daily, weekly, monthly reports on distribution, stock, cost, production and marketing performance •	Log all work tickets on JIRA on a daily basis •	Manage (team lead) and develop staff in order to drive efficiencies



About Uswww.spree.co.za

title: PORTFOLIO CONTRACTS MANAGER [PE]
description:
MAIN OUTPUTSÂ„ Monitor and ensure portfolio on time service delivery as per SLA's or as agreed with Customer.Â„ Pro-actively interact and engage with the Clients to understand areas of improvement and ensure that turn-around times are shortened to the satisfaction of the Clients.Â„ Develop effective, customer focused and proactive relationships at all levels in the customer chain.Â„ Manage allocated portfolio with regards to growth, retention, profitability and any other business relevant factors, thus ensuring portfolio performance targets are achieved in line with the Clients  business strategy.Â„ Identify and drive opportunities to improve and enhance Clients  service offerings.Â„ Leading, facilitating, developing and implementing relevant portfolio process improvements in order to achieve SLA targets.Â„ Ensure Health & Safety is a primary function and all mechanisms, processes and procedures are in place , monitored and adhered to at all times.Â„ Management of the portfolio budget, ensuring that proper utilization of allocated budget and being able to provide valid variance explanation on P&L’s.  Ensure compliance with policies and procedures related to financial management, controls and expenditure authorization levels.Â„ Put in place mechanisms, processes and procedures to ensure effective monitoring of performance related to quality management and standards.Â„ Monitor the productivity of all Human Capital allocated to the portfolio and ensure that all human capital operate to capacity.  Effectively deal with non-performance and destructive behaviour which might jeopardize Clients  standing with Telkom.Â„ Ensuring through Supply Chain that the portfolio has competent and diligent service providers to utilize in cases of emergencies and that such service providers are compliant with Clients  BBBEE strategy.Â„ Coaching, mentoring and counselling of staff not performing to the required standards and ensuring that employees improve on performance gaps highlighted during informal sessions and performance appraisals.KEY COMPETENCIESThe right person must have the following competencies: -Â„ Result OrientationÂ„ Business AcumenÂ„ 8 SA driver’s licenseÂ„ Must have 8 years’ experience in the building maintenance, engineering (building) or property (facilities management) environment.Â„ Must have 3 year’s managerial experience.Â„ title: Senior Software Developer
description:
Responsible for helping to lead Hyperion's web and mobile products for students in the developed and the developing world.  Lead the development of eLearning technology that is used to scale Hyperion's training in software development. Hyperion is the largest educational institution for Computer Science and software development in Africa and you will help lead its growth through its tech stack.  Work alongside the CEO (an ex Google Product Manager) to co-lead a team building and scaling tech products, working with a cutting-edge Django/Python/AWS Stack Focus on back-end or front-end development, helping lead a team of junior developers. Experience working in a fast-moving tech startup environment with a truly unique culture. Available as a role from our Johannesburg, Cape Town, Durban, or London offices or as a full remote role. Available as a full-time or part-time role (minimum 24 hours per week).  RequirementsEssentialExcellent written and oral communication skillsA problem-solving attitude 1-2 years programming experience in at least one modern programming language (eg Java/Python/C++/C#)At least 6 months of backend web development, preferably in a MVC frameworkAt least 6 months of experience with a version control system such as GitEvidence of software development outside just academic or university workStudying towards or holding a Computer Science degree or degree in a related area  Beneficial 3+ years of Python experience2-3 years of Django experience2-3 years Amazon Web Services experience5-7 years total on-the-job software development experienceExperience leading a technical teamExperience leading remote teamsMobile development experience React experienceResponsive design experienceDepending on this beneficial experience, this role may be offered as Chief Technology OfficerBenefitsYou'll gain career-defining experience working directly with partners like Google, Facebook, and the South African government on projects and technologies that reach thousands. Work as part of an international team which spans South Africa, Nigerian, and the UK to make a difference in the lives of our students. Working at Hyperion is an unparalleled opportunity to join a fresh and fast-paced startup that is disrupting the way education is delivered in the developing and developed world. Contribute as a core member of Hyperion's team, gaining access to a competitive salary package that may include stock options in the company Work as a part of an award-winning and dynamic team of experienced developers, marketing and sales staff, product managers, and software engineers to see how its done in 'the real world'. Experience working in a fast-moving tech startup environment with a truly unique culture. Be a part of executing Facebook and Google-supported projects at scale on the African continent. Specialise into software development, marketing & sales, community leadership, or product management.

title: Resident Engineer
description:
Resident Engineer in Cape Town, Western Cape.
 





 Resident Engineer'Cape Town, Western CapeR----- Per Annum Negotiable'PermanentClosing date: 08th February 2017

Preference will be given to AA Candidates.
Own vehicle and valid driver’s licence

 
QUALIFICATIONS

BSc/ENG or B Tech Degree in Civil Engineering.
Must be registered as a PR ENG/PR TECH.

 
EXPERIENCE

10 years plus experience in contract administration , site supervision and monitoring.
Experience as a contractor will be an advantage.

 
REQUIREMENTS

Experience and detailed understanding of FIDIC, GCC, JBCC and NEC contracts.
Experience in adjudication, mediation and arbitration processes.
Experience in quality control progress, payment certification, site measurements, issuing of site correspondence, work scheduling, financial and progress reports, community liaison and dispute evaluation and resolution.
Experience in the understanding and interpretation of SABS, COLTO and other relevant construction specifications .
Understanding of Construction Regulations and applicable legislation in respect of Health and Safety and Environmental requirements.
Strong communication skills in dealing with clients, contractors, local authorities and stakeholders (written and spoken).
Work scheduling and management of site staff.

title: Process Engineer
description:
Responsibilities: 

Managing the project execution schedule, cost and scope maintaining accountability throughout the project for funds allocation, schedule and scope changes;
Effectively managing risks to the project, communicating risks to relevant stakeholders and identifying solutions;
Integrating the services provided by all relevant project team members across the organisation to ensure that the full scope is delivered successfully within the manpower and budget requirements;
Keeping project stakeholders informed on progress and aligned throughout the course of the project providing timely communication to stakeholders;
Driving decision-making to ensure the project moves forward, minimising delays and setbacks;
Monitoring and ensuring adherence to legal requirements, policies, procedures and other client standards to ensure safe project execution;
Ensuring that the delivery of the scope of work is consistent with the statement of requirements and the business objectives for the Project;
Providing a pathway of communication between the Project Management Department and the Operation;
Monitoring the delivery of the Project to ensure that deviations from the plan are adequately managed and communicated and rectified;
Reporting on progress, status, risk and issues of these Projects;
Compiling inputs for the subsequent annual budgets;
Taking part in the strategic planning of Capital Project annual portfolio; and 
Contributing to the continuous improvement of the Project Management function at the client.

Requirements

BEng in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering (ECSA Professional Engineer Preferred)
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in Capital Projects of which 3 years directly managing with a proven track record of delivered projects;
PMP Certification or relevant Project Management Qualification will be an added advantage
Primavera or similar project schedule package training
HAZOP and Risk Management Training
Excellent interpersonal, facilitation and conflict management skills.
Excellent communication, planning and organizing skills.
Experience in line management functions required.
Highly organized, self-motivated and attention to detail.

 
 
Please note that, if your skills and experience do not match the requirements of this job, we will place your CV on our database and contact you as soon as a suitable position becomes available. It is not necessary for you to apply for more than one position as your CV will automatically be loaded onto our database where it will be available to all our consultants for future opportunities. 
Bazil Mdaka
Recruitment Lead

title: Project Manager_Primavera
description:
KEY PERFORMANCE AREAS:

Managing the project execution schedule, cost and scope maintaining accountability throughout the project for funds allocation, schedule and scope changes;
Effectively managing risks to the project, communicating risks to relevant stakeholders and identifying solutions;
Integrating the services provided by all relevant project team members across the organisation to ensure that the full scope is delivered successfully within the manpower and budget requirements;
Keeping project stakeholders informed on progress and aligned throughout the course of the project providing timely communication to stakeholders;
Driving decision-making to ensure the project moves forward, minimising delays and setbacks;
Monitoring and ensuring adherence to legal requirements, policies, procedures and other company standards to ensure safe project execution;
Ensuring that the delivery of the scope of work is consistent with the statement of requirements and the business objectives for the Project;
Providing a pathway of communication between the Project Management Department and the Operation;
Monitoring the delivery of the Project to ensure that deviations from the plan are adequately managed and communicated and rectified;
Reporting on progress, status, risk and issues of these Projects;
Compiling inputs for the subsequent annual budgets;
Taking part in the strategic planning of Capital Project annual portfolio; and
Contributing to the continuous improvement of the Project Management function at the company

 
POST REQUIREMENTS:

BEng in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering (ECSA Professional Engineer Preferred)
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in Capital Projects of which 3 years directly managing  with a proven track record of delivered projects;
PMP Certification or relevant Project Management Qualification will be an added advantage
Primavera or similar project schedule package training
HAZOP and Risk Management Training
Excellent interpersonal, facilitation and conflict management skills.
Excellent communication, planning and organizing skills.
Experience in line management functions required.
Highly organized, self-motivated and attention to detail

title: Millwright
description:
A vacancy is available at a Mine in the Lydenburg area for a Millwright.




 A vacancy is available at a Mine in the Lydenburg area for a Millwright.
Requirements:

Grade 12 / NQF 4 Numeracy and Literacy;
Qualified Millwright - Section 13;
Must be willing to work shifts;
At least five years’ experience in a heavy industry;
Trackless experience essential
Good communication skills in English.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Day to day maintenance and general engineering

Attending to breakdowns when required;
Ensure that safety is a priority;
Adhere to applicable statutory and legal requirements;
Minimise unplanned downtime and outages;
Must be able to work independently.

description:

description:

title: Section Engineering Manager
description:
A mining client based in Limpopo is in need of a Section Engineering Manager to join their company. 

Minimum Requirements:

• Government Certificate of Competency
• Five years Post Engineering qualification experience
• Proven ability in large Capex project management 
• Proven ability in minimizing Operational and Business Risk 
• Proven ability in protecting and managing capital assets 
• Experience in SAP: Planned Maintenance 
• Strategic Vision 2-5 years 
• Underground Mining experience (advantageous)

Should you meet the requirements for this position, you can forward your comprehensive CV to  or fax to 0867182242. Alternatively, you can phone Tendai / Precious/ Jennifer on 011 2346868/9 or visit our website on: www.staffingprojects.co.za

title: Managing Director - EPCM
description:
Executive OpportunityClient DetailsMy client is a global engineering firm that is looking to grow its presence extensively within Africa and beyond.Description
Responsible for maximising revenues and minimising operational costs
Lead the management team in all aspects of their business management and personnel development
Take management and strategy decisions to improve performance
Act as the company ambassador to promote brand to the customer
Be close to the market and competition in order to identify and explore opportunities for growth 
Ensure competitive pricing in line with business guidelines
Support international sales activity led directly by the business
Minimise costs associated with compromising sales and service delivery
Ensure consistent service quality
Operate to the highest standards of ethics, in accordance with the company values
Profile
Strong business leader who has managed a sizeable business portfolio (revenue and headcount)
At least 10+ years experience at a senior management level in a engineering environment (EPCM exposure a distinct advantage)
Recognised engineering degree qualification (non negotiable)
Track record and ability to converse with external stakeholders on regular basis
Must be driven to grow the business globally and possess strong communicative skills to work with global groups
Excellent P&L accountability skills
Structured operating mode but flexible to adapt to environmental / market changes
Job OfferMarket related.






 
 
This job is now closed. You can apply for other jobs by uploading your CV.

Engineering  draughtsman
CapeTown, South Africa
 Salary: R580 000 Per Annum 
                Recruiter: Hutech Head Office
                Job Ref: PTA006688/LDJ/1
                Our client is looking for an Engineering  Draughtsman in Cape Town, Western Cape.




 Engineering  DraughtsmanCape Town, Western CapeR----- Per Annum PermanentClosing date: 13th February 2017
ONLY AA candidates & South African citizens will be considered.
 
QUALIFICATIONS

Grade 12 with mathematics and the relevant AutoCAD software courses

 
EXPERIENCE

7 years’ experience in drawings
Experience in Civil 3D drawing packages will be an advantage.

 
RESPONSIBILITIES

Execute drawings and designs
Review drawings and drawing administration process                            
Support portion leaders with measurements and information gathering        
Information gathering and project administration.                                  
Engineering Designs and Technical Drawings.
Quantities and measurements to designs.
In-depth knowledge of draughting software and spatial  projections
Knowledge of township civil engineering services (water and sewer networks, roads and storm water).

title: Specialist: Sustainable Energy ( 5 year Fixed-Term) - SALGA National Office (Menlyn, Pretoria)
description:
Reporting to Executive Director: Municipal Infrastructure and Services, the incumbent’s role and responsibility shall include the following: Key Performance Areas â– Guide, support and provide expert advice and strategic guidance to municipalities in the area of sustainable energy which includes the implementation and follow work on the existing SALGA Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy strategy for Local Government â– Identify sector challenges for municipalities in the areas of sustainable energy, including at policy level and make recommendations towards addressing those challenges â–  Analyse municipal performance in terms of sustainable energy through benchmarking exercises. Identify strategies to improve performance as appropriate and profile and showcase best practices, including knowledge sharing of best practices to ensure effective service delivery within a municipal context  â–  Support the development of knowledge sharing products such as guidelines, tools, case studies and best practices to assist municipalities in complying with applicable legislation and policies and to support sustainable and resilient services â–  Represent local government in the development of national and even global policy and legislation in the areas of sustainable energy and advocate and lobby for enabling policy and legislative frameworks  â– Prepare position papers in consultation with municipalities â– Serve as an expert and strategic resource in the areas of sustainable energy to SALGA Provincial Offices and Structures, including the PEOs, Provincial Municipal Infrastructure and Services Programme Managers and Advisors â–  Engage and maximise opportunities with initiatives of development partners in the area of energy efficiency and renewable energy â– Develop and strengthen partnerships and collaboration with DoE, other national departments (DWAS, DEA) and other relevant institutions, in particular GIZ and Sustainable Energy Africa (SEA) with whom SALGA has an MOU â–  Support the exchange of experiences and know-how amongst municipalities and other municipal stakeholders like municipal utilities etc., in coordination with SALGA offices at provincial level â–  Facilitate capacity development in the area of municipal sustainable energy, e.g. coordination of training for municipal energy managers â–  Facilitate the establishment of enabling environment for the implementation of energy efficiency and renewable energy strategies â–  Provide ad-hoc support to municipalities when required.Qualifications and experienceâ–  An appropriate Post-Graduate University qualification or equivalent â–  At least 7 years’ experience operating at a senior management level within a medium to large-sized organization â–  Experience in Local Government â–  Experience in Electricity and/or Energy Efficiency/Renewable energy in South Africa, preferably in Local Government analysis and monitoring and evaluation â–  Experience in public policy analysis and drafting â– A valid code 08 drivers’ license and own vehicleCore knowledge, skills and behaviourâ– Understanding of government’s legislative process â–  Advisory or Consultancy Skills â– Good Communication Skills â–  Analytical skills â–  Knowledge of the relevant legislations â– Understanding of the Local Government environment â–  Strong Planning and Organising Skills â–  Client Orientated â– Results Driven â–  Computer LiteracyClosing Date: 22 February 2017, No later than 16h30

title: Quality Representative
description:
Primary purpose of the job

Reporting to the Group Quality Manager , this position requires the services of an individual to represent the Client to ensure that customer requirements are met with regards to the Quality and Availability of products 

Knowledge Requires+

Quality Concepts 
Manufacturing Processes
Customer Standards
Customer Products
Press and assembly knowledge 
Must be able to read engineering drawings and understand plans 
Computer Literacy

Skills Required

Communication and interpersonal skills
Attention to detail 
Analysis skills
Planning and organising 
Problem Solving 
Decision making
Customer Relations 
Report writing and presentation skills

Minimum Qualification Required

NQF Level 3 qualification or Grade 12
TQM
Auditing Certificate
Minimum 2 ears background within the automotive environment
Minimum 2 years exp in an automotive production environment

title: Specialist: Sustainable Energy - SALGA National Office (Menlyn, Pretoria)
description:
Reporting to Executive Director: Municipal Infrastructure and Services, the incumbent’s role and responsibility shall include the following: Key Performance Areas â– Guide, support and provide expert advice and strategic guidance to municipalities in the area of sustainable energy which includes the implementation and follow work on the existing SALGA Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy strategy for Local Government â– Identify sector challenges for municipalities in the areas of sustainable energy, including at policy level and make recommendations towards addressing those challenges â–  Analyse municipal performance in terms of sustainable energy through benchmarking exercises. Identify strategies to improve performance as appropriate and profile and showcase best practices, including knowledge sharing of best practices to ensure effective service delivery within a municipal context  â–  Support the development of knowledge sharing products such as guidelines, tools, case studies and best practices to assist municipalities in complying with applicable legislation and policies and to support sustainable and resilient services â–  Represent local government in the development of national and even global policy and legislation in the areas of sustainable energy and advocate and lobby for enabling policy and legislative frameworks  â– Prepare position papers in consultation with municipalities â– Serve as an expert and strategic resource in the areas of sustainable energy to SALGA Provincial Offices and Structures, including the PEOs, Provincial Municipal Infrastructure and Services Programme Managers and Advisors â–  Engage and maximise opportunities with initiatives of development partners in the area of energy efficiency and renewable energy â– Develop and strengthen partnerships and collaboration with DoE, other national departments (DWAS, DEA) and other relevant institutions, in particular GIZ and Sustainable Energy Africa (SEA) with whom SALGA has an MOU â–  Support the exchange of experiences and know-how amongst municipalities and other municipal stakeholders like municipal utilities etc., in coordination with SALGA offices at provincial level â–  Facilitate capacity development in the area of municipal sustainable energy, e.g. coordination of training for municipal energy managers â–  Facilitate the establishment of enabling environment for the implementation of energy efficiency and renewable energy strategies â–  Provide ad-hoc support to municipalities when required.Qualifications and experienceâ–  An appropriate Post-Graduate University qualification or equivalent â–  At least 7 years’ experience operating at a senior management level within a medium to large-sized organization â–  Experience in Local Government â–  Experience in Electricity and/or Energy Efficiency/Renewable energy in South Africa, preferably in Local Government analysis and monitoring and evaluation â–  Experience in public policy analysis and drafting â– A valid code 08 drivers’ license and own vehicleCore knowledge, skills and behaviourâ– Understanding of government’s legislative process â–  Advisory or Consultancy Skills â– Good Communication Skills â–  Analytical skills â–  Knowledge of the relevant legislations â– Understanding of the Local Government environment â–  Strong Planning and Organising Skills â–  Client Orientated â– Results Driven â–  Computer LiteracyClosing Date: 22 February 2017, No later than 16h30

title: Control Technician
description:
SCOPE & PURPOSE: Support manufacturing during continuous shift operation on all technical issues (electrical and mechanical ) with the primary aim to maintain machine availability and reliability. Employee will be required to perform breakdown maintenance, preventive maintenance inspections, machine condition monitoring, fault analysis and problem solving of process related failures.PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Problem solving of a technical nature requiring immediate action to ensure continuity of production Support of software and applications on systems involving variable speed drives, motion control systems, PLCs, SCADA systems, Ethernet network equipment and specialised measurement systems for float glass. Undertake software modifications and small projects for process optimization. Maintenance performance and Planning – to manage and develop a maintenance philosophy for specialised items of control equipment to ensure maximum plant availability Engineering Maintenance – provide schedules for preventative maintenance and services equipment and ensure schedules are updated and adhered to Capital Project Estimates and Planning – to provide accurate cost estimates and drawings in connection with capital projects and existing facilities Technological Development – to keep abreast of the technological developments taking place in the field of instrumentation, automation and control systems, especially as applied in the glass manufacturing field and evaluates appropriateness of this equipment. Drawings – to ensure relevant designs and drawings are to required specifications Loss Control – ensure activities are carried out in compliance with OHS Act Quality Control – responsible for the adherence to ISO 9000 standards in areas of responsibility2EDUCATIONAL BACKGROUND: Matric S4 Instrumentation or Electrical Engineering Qualification Millwright trade testEXPERIENCE / SKILLS 5 years post qualification apprentice experience in an industrial manufacturing operation. Should have a good appreciation of industrial instrumentation, particularly temperature, pressure measurement, and control valves (both pneumatic and electrical actuation). Must have hands-on experience of doing maintenance and small projects, including working with PLC and SCADA systems. Experience with Rockwell Control Logix PLCs and RS-View SE SCADA is an advantage. Should have experience with Variable Speed Drives and interfacing of these to PLC systems is required. Should have experience with closed loop PID control in an industrial environment. Experience with industrial communication networks is required. Proficiency in MS-Word and MS-Excel is required. Knowledge of Autocad and MS-Visio will be an advantage. Knowledge of preventative maintenance techniques and their application is desirable.6 years’ experience within a manufacturing environment.ATTRIBUTES: Self motivating and independent starter High energy to work in a fast pace environment Ability to work under pressure Deadline driven Supervisory skills Leadership ability

title: Electrician
description:
A power utility compani in Sunninghill is looking for an Electrician with 3 - 5 years experience
Must have matric/N3
Electrical trade certificate and a wireman's licence
Must be available immediately (6 - 12 months contract position)
Must have own car and dirvers licence
 
Duties includes:
Fault finding on electrical motors
Transformer maintenance
Fault finding on high and low voltage cable network and over head power lines
Maintenance on cable networks
Exposure to colling systems, pimps, air conditioning and refrigeration
 
Salary: between R100 - R150 per hour

title: Senior Estimator
description:
Formal Qualification

BSC Quantity Surveying degree or similar, preferably P.QS;
Knowledge of contract conditions e.g. FIDIC, NEC, BLUEBOOK, COLTO, etc is required;
Must have knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices and procedures within the construction field;

Experience
A minimum of 5 years estimating experience in the Civil and Building Industry.
 
Special Requirements

Tender preparation and submission
Prepare and submit all prequalification documentation accurately and completely as per tender specifications;


Client liaison.
Good interpersonal skills 

 
Computer Competency Requirements

Computer literate in MS Office


Must have thorough knowledge of CCS (estimating & site plan);

Languages (Written & Spoken)
Good command of the English language

title: Technical Director- Water
description:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:





 Project Delivery
Accountable for the overall success of all aspects of projects won or allocated. This includes contract negotiation, project management, managing timeliness, quality, risk management, project financial performance, communication and scope management of the projects, in line with the Aurecon methodology.Responsible for the monitoring and sharing of workloads and knowledge within Service Group Unit, for current and future workloads.Accountable for effective closeout of projects and debrief on all projects with the client, Client Relationship Executive/Managers and Project Leaders.Responsible for providing delivery support from the Service Group Unit to the Emerging Region projects, as required.Responsible for providing technical expertise and overseeing all technical aspects of a project (ie performs the role of a technical expert).Ensure the adequate contribution of technical knowledge and project experience to the competencies and services.
Winning Work and Client Relationships
Responsible for the development and maintenance of positive client relationships.Responsible for providing input to client proposals and tenders in conjunction with Business Development. This includes bid planning, facilitation, costing, writing, technical inputs and signoff required.Responsible for the ongoing marketing and promotion of the Aurecon brand through collaboration with Business Development.Responsible for achievement of revenue targets assigned by the Unit Manager, ensuring the achievement of relevant utilisation targets within team.
Financial Management
Manage project profitability and financial contribution for allocated projects.Ensure financial performance of the allocated projects in accordance with client proposals, business plans and budgets.
People Management and Competency Development
Responsible for the leadership, management, development and motivation of direct reports.Responsible for ensuring the ongoing development of careers and competencies, services and technologies within the Service Group.Provide input regarding appointment of professional staff in the Service Group Unit, as requested.
General Management
Responsible for the compliance to company policies and procedures, legislative requirements and act as a role model for Aurecon's values and behaviours.Demonstrate safety leadership in all aspects of Aurecon's business.Provide input into Unit or office business planning, as requested.








KEY QUALITIES AND SKILLS:






Understanding of business, risk and financial driversStrong project management and project leadership skillsStrong technical skillsAchievement and action orientated; solutions focussedOutstanding relationship and interpersonal skills; a strong collaboratorWell-developed leadership, communication, presentation, and influencing skillsAbility to adapt style to work effectively across geographic and cultural boundaries

title: Industrial Business Development Manager
description:
Established Engineering company seeks an experienced Industrial Business Development Manager.




 Established Engineering company seeks to appoint an experienced Industrial Business Development Manager, to grow business sustainably and profitably in the Industrial Product Range.The key target market for this product range is Industrial Clients, but the incumbent will also provide product support in the mining market segment. This will be done initially through direct customer engagement, but increased revenue will result in the development of a sales team to support this initiative. To grow sales through opportunities in the market and continuously seeks ways to improve profitability of existing accounts. The incumbent will also be responsible for all administration functions inherent with the position. Requirements:• Degree in Chemical / Industrial / Process Engineering or technical related field• 10 years commercial / sales / business development experience in an industrial environment• Previous experience and exposure in industry (+-5years)• Good vibrating screen/feeder and related machinery experience and plant and site exposure • High level of travelling involved and availability to travel must be flexible. Irregular working hours.

title: Contracts Manager
description:
As a Contracts Manager, you will be assigned to multiple projects, depending on size and complexity.




 As a Contracts Manager for my client, a Global Manufacturing Brand, you will be responsible for multiple projects where you will be accountable for adherence to the terms and conditions in both customer and sub-supplier contracts of the project and be responsible for pursuit of claims as well as general labour-related matters.
 
*The role requires frequent travel from their Headquarters to project sites.Client DetailsOur client is a Global Manufacturing Brand.DescriptionAs a Contracts Manager, your responsibilities will include the following:

Review and comment on commercial and technical tender terms and conditions;
Define contract management strategy to match contractual requirements;
Prepare an analysis of the prime contract's general terms and conditions to highlight areas of potential risk
Prepare contract risk mitigation plan with the project team and manage the plan's execution
Identify and prepare claims as they arise and coordinate the efforts to negotiate and resolve claims with the Legal Department.

 ProfileThe Contracts Manager should possess the following minimum requirements:

4-6 years of project-related experience
Control and Instrumentation exposure in the engineering/construction industry is essential for this role
LLB degree (or demonstrable knowledge of the legalities of contracts and their terms and conditions)
Experience in pricing, contract law and contract drafting
Basic labour/employee relations knowledge

The Contracts Manager will be required to travel frequently from Headquarters to the project sites.Job OfferThe salary on offer is highly negotiable depending on level of experience of the candidate.

title: Estimator - Roads & Surfacing(Centurion)
description:
ESTIMATOR -  CENTURION Responsible for compiling estimates of how much it will cost to provide a client or potential client with products or service by working out how much a project is likely to cost and create budgets accordingly for Roads & Surfacing projects.RESPONSIBILITIES• Acquire tender documents, drawings, information, etc. for various projects by: Scrutinizing advertisements in newspapers, periodicals, etc., or Invitation by the Client, Consulting Engineer, etc., or Hearsay Arrange collection of tender documents;•Analyse and assess tender projects in relations to the scope of work involved, budget value of the project, the resources required to complete the  project and noting any possible conflict with resources being utilised on existing contracts;•Determine the influence of the prevailing site conditions by conducting site inspections;•Clarify any obscurities in the scope of work by questioning the person conducting the site inspection and by noting questions asked by others;•Processing tender documentation;•Programme the work to be executed by: Summarising the quantities of major activities. Determining the team size and duration of activities. Liaising with other Estimators or members of that tender team. Prepare the tender program using the CCS Candy planning package.  Taking off quantities from the drawings, or Comparing take off quantities to billed quantities Tender Buying Clarifying anomalies in supplier’s/sub-contractor’s quotations and/or qualifications.•Estimating all work involving each project to be implemented;•Decide on the construction methodology by: Careful examination of the tender documentation including the project as a whole, the conditions of the contract, the project specifications,  drawings, site conditions•Analysing the site, equipment, personnel and expertise required.•Analysing and discuss with Management portions/sections of work which could be allocated to sub-contractors.•Estimate the unit cost rates for the tender project by using the CCS Candy package and: Calculating labour rates. Assessing the individual billed items and calculating the labour, material and plant contents. Comparing material suppliers and sub-contractor’s quotations. Comparing costs of different methods of construction. Using labour and plant outputs achieved on similar completed or existing contracts. Discussing proposed methods and labour production rates with the related Managers. •Amend the tender cost rates at post finalisation stage by adjusting the same as discussed during finalisation;•Complete the tender document as defined in the rules of that tender document, including the completion of all Returnable Schedules; •Execute delivery of the completed tender by delivering it to the relevant office;•Obtain the tender results (if possible) by recording these at public openings;•Assess the competitiveness of the tender by analysing the tender resultsREQUIREMENTSGrade 12 and a Certificate/Diploma/Degree in Civil/Building related tertiary qualification with Estimating experienceMinimum 2 years ‘experience in an estimating job related position;Minimum 2 years’ experience in an estimating and planning package system will be an added advantage.Must be Computer literate in MS Office;

title: Civil Engineer
description:
Royal HaskoningDHV is an independent, international engineering and project management consultancy with 135 years of experience. Our professionals deliver services in the fields of aviation, buildings, energy, industry, infrastructure, maritime, mining, transport, urban and rural development and water. Backed by expertise and experience of 6,500 colleagues across the world, we work for public and private clients in more than 150 countries. We understand the local context and deliver appropriate local solutions. Royal HaskoningDHV in South Africa, was formerly known as SSI Engineers and Environmental Consultants, and was founded in Johannesburg, South Africa in 1922. Registered as Stewart Scott (Pty) Ltd and trading as Stewart Scott International (SSI), the company owes its name to its founding fathers – George Stewart, a specialist in water cycle and municipal services projects and Frederick Scott, whose forté was transport and structural design. An innovator from its early years, SSI was one of the very first independent consulting engineering companies in Southern Africa and later, also one of the first to be established as an empowerment company. The company's name changed to SSI, a DHV company, in September 2006 after the DHV Group became the majority shareholder.Following the merger between DHV and Royal Haskoning in 2012, the company changed its name to reflect the international branding of the enlarged group.A vacancy exists in the eThekwini (Umhlanga) office of the Business Line Water in KZN for a suitably qualified and experienced Civil Engineer.

Main ResponsibilitiesEngineering design and GCC 2015 documentation;Contract administration;Project implementation;Project management and financial control;Preparation of proposals and tender submissions;Marketing and business development;Client liaison;Working in an integrated, multi-disciplinary professional team environment.

Minimum qualifications, skills and experienceBSc / BEng / BTech: Civil Engineering;Professional Registration with ECSA essential;Minimum 15 years relevant experience in bulk water supply or water/wastewater treatment;Experience in contract administration on civil works construction projects;Good report writing skills;Proven track record in client relationship management;Good commercial awareness;Working knowledge of isiZulu would be an advantage.

Behavioural competenciesCreative and innovative thinker;Commercially focused and resourceful;Culture fit to team;Ability to work both independently and as a team player;Mature, client centric with strong client relationship skills;Good interpersonal and communication skills;Ability to work under pressure;Organized, systematic, logical, meticulous and deadline and target driven.

title: Mechanical Foreman
description:
Reporting to the Maintenance Superintendent, the successful incumbent will be responsible for ensuring Manage the mechanical maintenance in the assigned sectional area at the Company under the confines of the company rules and regulations.Key performance areas include:Manage the maintenance system and execution as per ISO 55000 to      ensure asset care and management in order to achieve and maintain above      90% plant availability.Ensure data procurement of the section i.e. OEM manuals,      drawings in the centralized library.Ensure safe maintenance of machinery as per MHSA Act (Act 29 of      1996) as well applicable SANS standards.Ensure the work cycle management is functional and deviations      reviewed i.e. maintenance schedules, works orders & breakdowns.Ensure effective labour utilization effectiveness in the      section.Ensure cost management and report on variances.Demonstrate effective people management and leadership skills.Ensure correction on deviations from the condition monitoring reports.Reduce repeat      breakdowns in the section through conducting of investigations.Reduce mean time to repair (MTTR) on breakdowns.Ensure discipline when performing standby duties.Ensure compliance on overtime management (40 hours monthly      legal limit).Ensure good housekeeping where machinery is erected by adoption      of best practices.Ensure effective risk management upon maintenance execution.Ensure efficient shut management and compliance.Please email CV, a copy of qualifications, ID, and recent payslip to stephen@thecandidate.co.zaIf you are not contacted within a week, please consider your application unsuccessful 



Candidate Requirements

The ideal candidate will have the following:Mechanical Trade test,National Diploma in Mechanical Engineering (Advantageous),Minimum five years’ experience in a Mining and heavy duty industrial engineering, environment (preferably with supervisory experience.)Leadership ability in order to motivate and maintain a team spirit.Valid drivers licencelease email CV, a copy of qualifications, ID, and recent payslip to stephen@thecandidate.co.zaIf you are not contacted within a week, please consider your application unsuccessful 




Required Skills

mining : 5 to 6 yearsmanufacturing supervisor : 3 to 4 years

Apply Now



















Job Summary
General Manager for a Structural Steel fabrication and erection CompanyFrancistown Botswana.OTHER INFORMATION:Well established Company that is a part of a larger groupCompany based in Francistown Botswana.Good options for growth and personal deve...




Job Details

General Manager for a Structural Steel fabrication and erection CompanyFrancistown Botswana. OTHER INFORMATION:Well established Company that is a part of a larger groupCompany based in Francistown Botswana.Good options for growth and personal development.Candidate must be willing to relocate.Negotiable package based on qualifications and experience, which may include incentive options. CANDIDATE PRE-REQUISITES: Formal qualifications in Mechanical or Structural Steel Engineering;Aged between 35 – 45 years ;Experience in Structural Steel fabrication;Managing sites with crews of up to 100 Artisans/Welders/Riggers of various skill level;Flexibility to travel freely throughout Sub-Saharan Africa;Proven track record of business administration, finance and management.  DUTIES:  The duties include but are not limited to the following:Develop and maintain sincere, professional and mutually supportive relationships with customers and their personnel, furthering our Company brand/image.Strategic inputs for the sustainability and growth of the company.Have a “hands on” approach to all facets of the Business.Overall general management of the marketing, estimating, raw material, purchase and control debtors collection, production and quality functions of the division using the time proven techniques of planning, organizing, leading and control.Liaison and co-operation with the service functions of accounting, job costing, debtors and creditors.Ensure that company assets: stock and wip, equipment, machinery and tools under your control are looked after and maintained cost effectively.Ensuring that man hours, materials and consumables are correctly allocated to the respective jobs and contracts. Reviewing job cost sheets and raising queries on misallocation, investigating overruns on labour, material and consumable costs and taking corrective action. Produce monthly reports summarizing each job, their costs and profitability.Being proactive to changes in the market place with regards to price, delivery and workload so that adjustments can be made to quoted prices, raw material purchasing and manpower requirements to optimize outputs and minimize costs.Ensuring that all transactions are in the best interests of the company and that conditions of offer/acceptance are stipulated/negotiated to minimize debtors collection days and satisfy company cash flow requirements. Put forward Capital Application Motivations for productivity and growth.Enforce the Company’s disciplinary policy, and provide the necessary support the Workshop Supervisors in the enforcement of discipline of the Workshop staff.Research and implement various marketing and growth strategies.Assist with the research and successful exhibitions at Trade shows.Provide the necessary training (internal/external) to ensure efficient running of the Company. ProductionManagement of the Workshop using the proven techniques of planning, organizing, leading and control of outputs and quality.Be responsible for the profitable manufacture and completion of all work and jobs in the company to the satisfaction of the customers which includes quality and delivery. Optimize and control man hours to agreed pre-set levels.Liaison and co-operation with the marketing, estimating, quality, purchasing and stores functions to ensure optimum completion of the jobs.Understanding the technical, quality and delivery requirements of the jobs to ensure customer expectations are met.Ensuring that man hours, materials, consumables and maintenance costs are correctly allocated to the respective jobs, contracts and accounting codes. Being proactive to correct any negative variances that may be occurring on any job.Be proactive to changes in the workload so that adjustments can be made to optimize outputs and minimize costs.                Ensuring that workshop, equipment, machines and tools are maintained cost effectively.Ensure that housekeeping is to high standard of lay-out, storage, neatness and cleanliness, i.e.: A place for everything and everything in its place.Ensure that the safety and first aid are in accordance with the applicable Statutory Instruments and Acts. Liaising with customers and independent inspectors in order to satisfy their shop floor requirements.Assisting with any other aspects required by the company. Estimating / Planning and Design / DraftingUnderstanding customer requirements drawings, specifications, quality and delivery.Ensuring that the company’s exposure is clearly defined by specifically including/excluding items on the scope of work.    Undertaking site and equipment measurements and converting them to working sketches.Compiling detailed Bills of Materials, item take-offs from drawings, sketches and data sheets and arranging material optimization (nesting etc).Interpreting data sheets and specifications into sketches that can be estimated from.Obtaining accurate competitive costs of materials from suppliers and stock and liaising with subcontractors and works to estimate realistic manpower inputs and delivery times.Understanding and applying relevant design and manufacturing codes of practice (ASME, API) and standards so that accurate cost estimates and drawings       Preparing and presenting detailed and accurate quotations, proposals and contracts.Collecting relevant technical books and brochures to build up a technical data base. Being fully computer literate and competent on the relevant computer packages, Auto Cad, Inventor and other relevant software.Liaising with and providing service to the other departments in ensuring the jobs are processed expediently into the works and that specification, quality and delivery are compiled with.Undertake courses and studies to fully understand the metallurgy, fabrication and welding of stainless steels.Filing estimates quotations and drawings in a neat, orderly and retrievable manner.Processing estimates and MRP onto the Syspro system and keeping overall job planning and resources live.Assisting management with projects where necessary.Compare estimates with actual to modify estimating methodology.Compiling strike rate statistics to evaluate competitiveness.  Any other duties required by management in any of the associated companies. CRITICAL SUCCESS FACTORSReaching pre-agreed budgets, sales gross margin, gross profit and manpower ratios for the division. Ensuring that the division can grow at budgeted levels.Having zero jobs rejected by customers (Uncompromising Quality).Attaining ISO 9001/2008 Registration.Keeping scrap and rework below 3%.Have no accidents or lost time incidents.Debtors days average 45 days or less.Ensuring that the Division grows at least 16% per annumBuilding long term relationships with customers BUSINESS FUNDAMENTALSDrive up selling priceForce down cost priceIncrease profitabilityGrowth!  



Candidate Requirements

Formal qualifications in Mechanical or Structural Steel Engineering;Aged between 35 – 45 years ;Experience in Structural Steel fabrication;Managing sites with crews of up to 100 Artisans/Welders/Riggers of various skill level;Flexibility to travel freely throughout Sub-Saharan Africa;Proven track record of business administration, finance and management.

title: Sustainability Support Coordinator
description:
The sustainability Support Coordinator will be responsible for coordinating and providing a support function for BBBEE and Transformation.The successful candidate will be required to prepare, monitor and document training activities in the Company.Responsibilities:BBBEE and Charter ComplianceObtain information for STIRR Process (internal verification audit tool).Compile STIRR process reports for BU.Facilitate and manage data required for audit purposes.Prepare reports for management meeting on progress.Assist with the implementation and monitoring of transformation progress.Set BBBEE scorecard plan targets with elements accountable persons.Coordinate transformation focus groups, workshop and coaching staff.Keep current with latest legislative changes.Employment Equity involvement:Interact with the BU EE initiatives.Arrange and monitor initiatives toward executing EE initiatives.Manage and consolidate EE statistics and records together with HR through the HR personnel system.Enterprise Development Programme:Assess potential ED candidates and businesses.Coordinate and record Enterprise Development mentorship.Compile ED Partner performance reports.On-board process for Enterprise Development and BBBEE for sites.Coordinate with the Training Department SLDP for ED Partners.Socio Economic Development Initiatives:Be the first point of contact for CSI initiatives.Coordinate CSI initiatives and ensure all divisional CSI initiatives are recorded and reported.Bid SupportWrite BBBEE tender submission documents.Compile ED plans for bids.Complete sustainability and BBBEE submission datasheets for tenders.

title: Engineer Crusher
description:
Section Engineer: Cr..
                Section Engineer: Crushers




 Section Engineer: Crushers to direct and control the maintenance functions of the primary and secondary crusher plants according to sound engineering and maintenance practices to ensure maximum equipment and plant availabilities in line with production capability and organisational strategic objectives.
Duties include but not limited to the following:
• Manage and control maintenance processes within the department• Ensure compliance to health and safety requirements• Compile and manage budget• Ensure compliance to SHREQ• Manage projects• Perform administration• Design and implement maintenance policies and procedures• Ensure appropriate staffing requirements• Develop and performance manage staff
Qualifications, Experience and Skills:

Five (5) years extensive maintenance experience in Primary gyratory (Metso & Kawasaki) and Secondary hydrocone and cone crushers (Metso & Symons)
• B Eng. or BTech in Mechanical Engineering
GCC (Mines & Works) will be advantageous
Computer literacy
Project Management
Primary and Secondary Crushing
Conveying system
Material wearing & handling
Pumping
Vibration analysis
People development principles
SHREQ Code as per legal environment/ safety and health management

Salary: Market Related
Please answer the following questions:
Do you have previous experience in a similar role?:*
Maintenance experience in Primary and Secondary Crushers gained within the Mining IndustryMaintenance experience in Primary and Secondary Crushers gained within other industry/sMaintenance experience in Primary Crushers onlyOther maintenance experience gainedNo maintenance experience but willing to learn
 
How many years maintenance experience do you have in Primary and Secondary Crushers?:*
 Less than 3 years 3 - 5 years 5 - 8 years More than 8 years Not experienced in Primary and Secondary Crushers
Do you have Five (5) years extensive maintenance experience in Primary gyratory (Metso & Kawasaki) and Secondary hydrocone and cone crushers (Metso & Symons)?
Interested applicants are requested to submit their CV’s with certified copies (By the SAPD and not older than 3 months) of the following Documents:

ID & Driver’s license
Matric Certificate
Degree / Diploma
GCC Mines & Works

Estelle Vermaak
E-mail:---------------- / pcc5@------

Candidate needs to have 3 years post graduate experience in plant maintenance projects within a continuous production environmentQualifications•	BSc Degree in Engineering (Mechanical) •	A Government Certificate of Competency will be advantageous.•	At least 3 years’ experience in a continuous process operation, preferably a glass manufacturing environment.Key Accountabilities and Attributes:•	Primary function is to execute projects as identified and required by the user/production:o	Project initiation Processes include: feasibility studies, writing specifications, justifications, Capital expenditure and extra ordinary expenditure approvals, o	Designing, problem identification and creative problem solving skills are required.o	Issue and adjudicate tender documents, o	Facilitate equipment selection, get quotes and liaise with contractors and supplierso	Draw up budgets and project plans.o	Compile and manage contracts (FIDIC, JBC, NEC).o	Contractors to be managed to ensure work is executed safe and in accordance with the requirements of the OHS-act.o	Ensure contracts and projects are executed on time and in budget.o	Ensure that relevant notifications, applications and communication procedures are followed to all relevant internal and external departments and as required by Law and local By-laws.o	Compile quality control and quality assurance procedures and ensure they are followed. These to include project risk assessments.o	Run project and contractor co-ordination meetings.o	Proper commissioning and acceptance procedures to be implemented.o	Ensure project documents, drawings and COC’s are signed off and filed, training is done and equipment is handed over to the operations with SOP’s, risk assessments and any other relevant documents such as MSDS’s.o	Ensure that maintenance requirements and procedures are entered the PM system and scheduled for execution.o	 Ensure that required spares are in stock. o	Generate monthly reports on all areas of responsibility•	Plant Maintenance functions and operational functions:o	Site maintenance responsibilities that fall under the project department include:?	Buildings, roofing, floors,?	Roads, storm water,?	Fences, ?	Externals services such as water supply, sewage, natural gas supply?	Power supply and lighting.o	Do regular inspections and ensure PM-schedules are in place, executed and optimized.o	Participate and lead Continuous Improvement projects and WCM (World Class Manufacturing) projects. o	Assist the maintenance department with maintenance work during shutdowns, breakups, where major repairs are done or are required from time to time.o	Conduct research to solve practical engineering problems and to improve efficiency.o	Do standby as required.o	Provide support to the business to ensure that plant operations meet environmental and safety protocols in a cost-effective mannerExperience/Skills•	Be a competent manager and can lead and motivate people.•	Should be a skilled project manager, know project execution principles, and be able to plan multiple contractors and activities.•	A high level of skill in working with contractors is essential.•	Have experience in implementing and ensuring OHS-Act requirements are adhered to.•	Demonstrate a proven, successful, hands-on track record in the maintenance of machinery in a production environment. •	Have a working knowledge of civil, electrical and control engineering.•	Demonstrate a high level of problem solving skills
